greeting: Greetings from The On-Line Encyclopedia of Integer Sequences! http://oeis.org/

results.name: Numbers having exactly four representations by the quadratic form x^2+xy+y^2 with 0<=x<=y.
comment: A088534(a(n)) = 4; subsequence of A118886, see also A003136.
link: Reinhard Zumkeller, Table of n, a(n) for n = 1..250
mathematica: amax = 20000; xmax = Sqrt[amax] // Ceiling; Clear[f]; f[_] = 0; Do[q = x^2 + x y + y^2; f[q] = f[q] + 1, {x, 0, xmax}, {y, x, xmax}];
A198775 = Select[Range[0, 3 xmax^2], # <= amax && f[#] == 4&] (* _Jean-François Alcover_, Jun 21 2018 *)
results.author: _Reinhard Zumkeller_, Oct 30 2011
